lines.text:
[she is beating him in tennis]
Sorry!
Will you stop saying that!
[last lines]

Oh yes, Lake is magical, for as we kissed, and I could swear that music played. Now the war's over, we've come back. To our relief, the villa is still here. Last night we drank champagne and we raised our glasses to Miss Beaumont. After all, it's thanks to her we are together. And she was magical, too. Our holidays are planned till the end of time. Every year we'll spend springtime in the mountains, and every summer, a month by the lake.
Oh, sorry for making you angry.

[clearly angry]
You didn't!
I'm sometimes surprised that this place is still here. I thought it would die with him.
I can't go back to America. My mother would probably have me arrested!

[is tipsy, speaking to Wilshaw]
You know what you remind me of, sitting over there? A candlestick!

[speaking of the Italians]
Soon we'll all be in uniform!
Well I for one sincerely hope that is not so.
Here's a proposition for you. Stay here for a month, or I'll chuck you into the lake.

[smiles]
You wouldn't dare.

[calls his children in from the woods]
Time to go home!

[pleased]
When I left this morning, you said you wish that we had gotten to know each other.

[flustered]
Did I say that?
Oh yes you did. I remember every word!
I've been waiting here for two hours!
I never said I didn't know how to play tennis, I said that I haven't played it in years!
Is this all the thanks I get? If I hadn't led him on, he wouldn't be here now, would he?

[talking about Wilshaw while on a motorcycle]
Is he your boyfriend?
No! He's not my type!
Can I take some pictures?
What?...
[smiles]
Oh yes. Sure, sure!
Are you lost?
We missed the boat!
[Glances cheerfully at Wilshaw]
My fault.
It's a long way to walk, I'll give you a ride!
Well I don't know...
Your husband can come with me.

[Flustered]
I'm not her husband! Good God!
Better not miss your train!
English girls and Italian men are good!
I'm an English woman, there's a difference.
Dear Major, I'm so sorry you're going before we've had a chance to get to know each other. Such a waste.
[first lines]
The story begins on Lake Como, many years ago during the last fantastic summer before the war.

Returning to the lake has always seemed like coming home. Everyone is so friendly. Everyone is welcome. The Villa Barbianello basks all day long in the lakeside sun, which is hotter than usual for late April.
Oh, you aren't quite what I expected.
Old and starchy?
It seems we've both been unlucky in love.
Perhaps we should stick to tennis...
God, you remind me of my mother.
And you remind me of mine.
